member.name: M:WidgetTestService.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.name: M:WidgetTestService.DAL.WidgetContext.OnModelCreating(System.Data.Entity.DbModelBuilder)
member.summary: This method is called when the model for a derived context has been initialized, but before the model has been locked down and used to initialize the context. The default implementation of this method does nothing, but it can be overridden in a derived class such that the model can be further configured before it is locked down.
member.param: The builder that defines the model for the context being created.
member.remarks: Typically, this method is called only once when the first instance of a derived context is created. The model for that context is then cached and is for all further instances of the context in the app domain. This caching can be disabled by setting the ModelCaching property on the given ModelBuidler, but note that this can seriously degrade performance. More control over caching is provided through use of the DbModelBuilder and DbContextFactory classes directly.

member.name: M:WidgetTestService.DAL.WidgetContext.MarkAsModified``1(``0)
member.summary: Generic method to mark the entity as modified.

member.name: T:WidgetTestService.Migrations.Configuration
member.summary: Class Configuration. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:WidgetTestService.Migrations.Configuration.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:WidgetTestService.Migrations.Configuration.Seed(WidgetTestService.DAL.WidgetContext)
member.summary: Runs after upgrading to the latest migration to allow seed data to be updated.
member.param: Context to be used for updating seed data.
member.remarks:
Note that the database may already contain seed data when this method runs. This means that implementations of this method must check whether or not seed data is present and/or up-to-date and then only make changes if necessary and in a non-destructive way. The
can be used to help with this, but for seeding large amounts of data it may be necessary to do less granular checks if performance is an issue. If the database initializer is being used, then this method will be called each time that the initializer runs. If one of the , , or initializers is being used, then this method will not be called and the Seed method defined in the initializer should be used instead.
